plugins.name: Select and Inspect
plugins.description:
Why?


If you ever implemented a Figma plugin, you know how slow the process of inspecting specific properties (among the hundreds available) and values in a Figma file is.


This plugin aims to solve this problem by making logging as easy as possible!


Features

  1. Select one or more Figma elements to get them logged in the Console
  2. Add expressions to be evaluated on the selected Figma elements (name,id,reactions[0].actions results in each expression to be evaluated and logged in the Console)
  3. Stringy and format the result for better readability
  4. Preferences are stored locally


FAQ

Why not using the existing "Inspector" plugin?

Because the properties must be added to the UI by the plugin's author, limiting the plugin's scalability (as you can see in the reviews).
plugins.tagline: Select an item and get it logged in Console

plugins.name: Voice to Text for Figma
plugins.description:
Easily insert text into Figma using your voice!

Click ‚ÄúOpen Voice Tool‚Äù ‚Üí Start speaking in the browser ‚Üí Your speech will be transcribed and automagically added into your selected Figma text layer.

No typing. Just talking.


‚úÖ Use Case 1:

‚ÄúTired of switching between docs and Figma just to copy-paste written content?‚Äù

Speak directly into the plugin‚Äôs voice tool and instantly push the transcription into your selected text box‚Äîno tab switching, no distractions.


‚úÖ Use Case 2:

‚ÄúWant to insert longer text into your Figma design without typing it all out?‚Äù

Use Voice to Text for Figma to dictate your content and have it transcribed directly into your design‚Äîperfect for mockups, user flows, or note-taking during brainstorming.


Supported Features & Limits:

‚úÖ Languages Supported: English, Arabic, Chinese (Simplified), Dutch, French, German, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish

üïê Time Limit: Records up to 60 seconds per session, auto-warns you before timeout

üåê Browser Compatibility:

‚úÖ Supported: Google Chrome, Safari, Opera, Samsung Internet

‚ö†Ô∏è Partially Supported: Microsoft Edge, Firefox

‚ùå Not Supported: Internet Explorer, Brave, Arc

üß† Auto-restart: On silence to ensure smoother capture

üéô Microphone Permission : Detects and guidance for Mac & Windows users.

üñ•Ô∏è Figma Compatibility: Works seamlessly on both Figma Browser and Figma Desktop / Mac App

‚úÖ Accessibility Enhancements

‚ù§Ô∏è Open Source Code: https://github.com/mryeshwanth/voice-figma-plugin


How it works:

  1. When you click Open Voice Tool, a new browser window will open to start recording.
  2. This is required because Figma Mac/Desktop plugins can‚Äôt access your microphone directly.
  3. The tool uses your browser's built-in Web Speech API (SpeechRecognition) to transcribe your voice locally ‚Äî nothing is sent to any external server.
  4. Once done, the transcription is securely sent back to the Figma plugin and inserted into your selected text node.
plugins.tagline: Convert your voice to text, directly into Figma.

plugins.name: Smart Rename
plugins.description:
Smart Rename is a powerful Figma plugin built to streamline your workflow by letting you bulk rename frames customizable base names and smart suffixes like version numbers, dimensions, or sequence numbers.


It also fixes a common frustration in UI design: decimal positioning. When frames have non-integer X or Y values, exported assets often end up with unwanted white lines or blurry edges. Smart Rename solves this by auto-aligning frames to the nearest whole pixel, ensuring clean, sharp exports every time.


From organization to export-readiness, this plugin saves time and eliminates manual, error-prone tasks‚Äîall in a few clicks.
plugins.tagline: Bulk rename and align Figma frames in seconds. Add version, size, or number suffixes effortlessly.

plugins.name: Time2Frame
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that lets you analyze, adjust, and visualize animation settings in real-time‚Äîenhancing precision and efficiency in motion design.


How It Works:


1. Animation Data Extraction

Instantly retrieve animation properties from selected frames, including:

  1. Animation Type: Move In, Fade, Smart Animate, and more.
  2. Direction: Left, Right, Top, Bottom.
  3. Easing Curve: Ease In, Ease Out, Linear, Custom Spring.
  4. Timing Details: Delay and duration (in milliseconds).

Effortlessly gain insights into how animations behave within your prototypes.


2. Frame Rate Conversion

Easily convert animation timing into frame counts based on industry-standard frame rates:

  1. 24 FPS
  2. 30 FPS
  3. 60 FPS

The plugin automatically recalculates delays and durations into frames, ensuring precise control over motion timing.


3. Real-Time Input Adjustments

Modify Delay and Duration values directly in the plugin and see instant updates in:

  1. Milliseconds (for precise timing).
  2. Frames (for seamless animation alignment across FPS settings).

No need for manual calculations‚ÄîTime2Frame does it all for you.


4. Animation Preview

Visualize how your animation moves, scales, and fades with an interactive preview. The preview dynamically adjusts to reflect extracted animation properties, allowing designers to fine-tune their animations with confidence.


5. Custom Spring Curve Calculation & Visualization

If a Custom Spring easing is detected, Time2Frame breaks it down into:

  1. Stiffness
  2. Damping
  3. Mass

The plugin generates a real-time graph that illustrates the spring curve, making it easy to refine complex motion dynamics.


Key Features:


  1. Animation Data Extraction ‚Äì Retrieve animation type, easing, and timing in seconds.
  2. Frame Rate Conversion ‚Äì Automatically convert timing into frames for 24, 30, or 60 FPS.
  3. Instant Adjustments ‚Äì Modify animation values with real-time updates.
  4. Live Animation Preview ‚Äì See how animations behave with accurate visual feedback.
  5. Custom Spring Analysis ‚Äì Break down spring physics and visualize easing curves.
  6. Smart UI Integration ‚Äì Works seamlessly with Figma‚Äôs native environment.


Who Is It For?


Time2Frame is built for motion designers, UX/UI designers, and developers who need precise animation breakdowns and real-time adjustments in Figma. Whether you‚Äôre fine-tuning micro-interactions or optimizing complex motion flows, this plugin streamlines your workflow and improves animation predictability across different frame rates.
plugins.tagline: Designed for motion designers‚Äîselect a frame, instantly analyze its animation settings in real time.

plugins.name: GradCover
plugins.description:
"Cover Gradient Pro is a Figma plugin crafted specifically for users looking to enhance their design documents with eye-catching gradient covers. Whether it's for branding manuals, product catalogs, or personal portfolios, this plugin assists in swiftly creating professional and visually striking cover designs.


With Cover Gradient Pro, you can expect:


A rich palette of gradient options to diversify your cover design choices.

One-click cover generation to streamline the design process and save valuable time.

Highly customizable gradient features, allowing you to adjust colors and effects to fit your design needs.

Seamless integration with Figma, ensuring your cover designs blend perfectly with your project documents.

To use Cover Gradient Pro, simply select the elements you wish to apply a gradient to, and use the plugin's intuitive controls to choose and adjust your preferred gradient for your cover. Transform your designs with the power of Cover Gradient Pro and give your work the standout cover it deserves."

plugins.name: Better Title Case
plugins.description:
Not a fan of built-in Figma's title case? Better Title Case got your back!


  1. Select a frame or a group to apply Better Title Case to all text layers inside
  2. Or directly select one or several text layers to apply Better Title Case only to these layers


Safe to use on text layers that have several styles/properties applied to them ‚Äî plugin will not remove bold or underlined text from your layers.


Current Capitalization Rules:

  1. UPPERCASE words are not processed, so AAPL or MBA will stay as is.
  2. The first and the last word in a sentence are always processed.
  3. There is a custom list of words that shouldn‚Äôt be in converted to Title Case: and, as, but, for, if, nor, or, so, yet, a, an, the, as, at, by, for, in, of, off, on, per, to, up, via, vs, v, (vs.) (v.)
  4. Word after em dash and slash processed even if it's a minor word.


If you have any feedback or ideas on improving the plugin ‚Äî feel free to reach out via email or in comment section üòâ.
plugins.tagline: Title Case Plugin We All Deserve

plugins.name: Ripplix - Animation Library
plugins.description:
Ripplix ‚Äî friction-free design hand-off with motion

Skip the time-consuming prototypes and pin real-world interactions straight onto your Figma file.

Ripplix already has a curated library of 1 500 + micro-interactions from 300 + live apps & sites into an easy-to-search sidebar. One click drops a comment tag on the exact UI element (button, card, tab‚Ä¶) and links to a full-screen preview on ripplix.com so developers instantly see how it should feel‚Äîtiming, easing, choreography and all.


Why you‚Äôll use it every hand-off

  1. Contextual pins ‚Äì Each animation is attached as a Figma comment on the layer you select, so engineers don‚Äôt have to hunt for it.
  2. Real-app reference ‚Äì Every clip comes from production UIs, giving devs proven motion patterns instead of speculative mocks.
  3. Search that speaks UX ‚Äì Filter by platform (Web, iOS, Android, Watch), pattern (hover, dropdown, empty state‚Ä¶), industry or keyword.
  4. One-click preview ‚Äì Comment contains a ‚ÄúView on Ripplix‚Äù link ‚Üí opens the HD interaction with playback controls, frame counter and downloadable Lottie/CSS snippets.
  5. Zero bloat ‚Äì Nothing is embedded in the Figma file except a tiny thumbnail + link, so your files stay light.


Typical Workflow

  1. Select a layer that needs motion polish.
  2. In the Ripplix sidebar search ‚Äúhover + dropdown‚Äù.
  3. Preview candidates; click Add to Figma.
  4. A comment tag appears on your layer, click upon you can preview the motion.
  5. During hand-off, devs open the link, watch the real interaction, and build it confident they‚Äôre matching the reference.


Need help or want to suggest an animation we‚Äôre missing?

üìß support@ripplix.com


Install Ripplix ‚Üí pin a motion reference ‚Üí ship delightful, on-brand interactions‚Äîwithout another endless prototype.
plugins.tagline: Inspiring for better Interaction

plugins.name: Figma to Azure
plugins.description:
Create Azure work items without leaving Figma ¬∑ figmatoazure.com


Key Features

  1. One-Click Creation: Select any Figma component to generate an Azure Board item.
  2. Automatic Previews: Visuals attach directly to the work item.
  3. Direct Linking: Clickable links between Azure work items and components.
  4. Custom Field Mapping: Match your Azure setup with flexible field configs.
  5. Team Area Support: Organize work in your project‚Äôs structure.
  6. Smart Field Detection: Autofills required Azure fields.


Why Teams Use It

  1. Save time‚Äîno more screenshots or copy-paste.
  2. Developers get full visual context.
  3. Sync design and dev workflows effortlessly.
  4. Keep everything traceable and connected.


How to Get Started

  1. Select a Figma component
  2. Add your Azure Personal Access Token (requires Read & Write access for work items)
  3. Enter your Azure DevOps URL
  4. Customize the item
  5. Click Create


That‚Äôs it‚Äîthe plugin handles previews, links, and field setup for you.

plugins.name: ContentFlow
plugins.description:
ContentFlow is the ultimate text manager for Figma, designed to keep designs, copy, and teams perfectly aligned. Whether you want to gather and review edits before updating your designs or streamline developer handoff, this plugin simplifies every aspect of text management.


Here‚Äôs what you can expect:

  1. ‚è≥ Postpone Text Updates: Accumulate edits without immediately applying them‚Äîbatch updates or finalize them as needed.
  2. üîé Real-Time Change Detection: Automatically track every tweak in Figma, highlighting modified or removed text layers for quick review.
  3. üë• Collaborative Updates: Every team member with the plugin sees changes in the file, ensuring everyone stays on the same page.
  4. ‚è™ Complete Version History: Access a full log of edits anytime, and revert to previous versions in a click ‚Äî ideal for instant rollbacks or detailed audits.
  5. üè∑Ô∏è Easy Status Labeling: Use four statuses (Progress, Done, Rejected, Dev) to clearly show where each piece of text stands.
  6. üöÄ Developer Mode: Give developers a clean interface showing only finalized content, with one-click copying and preserved formatting.
  7. üåê Smart Organization: Search and filter text by status, date, or keywords, with items neatly grouped by frames for instant clarity.
  8. üé® Adaptive UI: Switch between light and dark themes, and toggle to a compact layout when you need to save screen space‚Äîalways keeping things clear and intuitive.


Keep your text workflow efficient, organized, and worry-free. ContentFlow ensures designers, writers, and developers stay perfectly synced with minimal fuss and maximum productivity!

plugins.name: Populate JSON data
plugins.description:
‚ú® JSON-to-Design Plugin

üöÄ Supercharge Your Design Workflow


Bring your templates to life with data-driven automation! The JSON-to-Design Plugin allows you to effortlessly populate and duplicate designs using simple JSON files.


Key Features


‚úÖ Upload JSON Files

Supports two formats:


  1. Array format: Automatically duplicates selected designs for each object in the array while replacing placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}.


{
"array": [
{ "name": "John", "surname": "Doe" },
{ "name": "Emma", "surname": "Walker" },
{ "name": "Liam", "surname": "Harris" }
]
}


  1. Object format: Updates a single design with JSON values without duplication.


{
"name": "John",
"surname": "Doe"
}


‚úÖ Dynamic Placeholder Replacement

Replace {{name}}, {{surname}}, or other placeholders in text elements with real data‚Äîseamlessly integrate information into your designs.


‚úÖ Save Time and Effort

Eliminate repetitive manual tasks by automating data entry and duplication. Perfect for projects requiring consistent layouts with unique data sets.


How to Use

üéØ Follow these simple steps to get started:


Upload Your JSON File

Upload a correctly formatted JSON file using the plugin. Choose between the array format or object format depending on your use case.

Select the Layer

Highlight the Figma layer containing text objects with placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}. Ensure these placeholders are named correctly.

Click ‚ÄúPopulate Design‚Äù

Let the plugin work its magic! It will duplicate designs or populate data based on your JSON file.


üí° Tip: Double-check placeholder names in your design to match JSON keys for smooth operation.


Why Choose JSON-to-Design?


üí° Smart Automation: Unlike other plugins, this tool simplifies both duplication and data replacement in one intuitive flow.

‚è± Time-Saving Magic: Whether you‚Äôre working with a few data points or hundreds, let the plugin handle the heavy lifting while you focus on creativity.
plugins.tagline: The plugin allows you to upload a JSON file and, based on it, populate designs with this data.

How to Use

üéØ Follow these simple steps to get started:


Upload Your JSON File

Upload a correctly formatted JSON file using the plugin. Choose between the array format or object format depending on your use case.

Select the Layer

Highlight the Figma layer containing text objects with placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}. Ensure these placeholders are named correctly.

Click ‚ÄúPopulate Design‚Äù

Let the plugin work its magic! It will duplicate designs or populate data based on your JSON file.

plugins.name: Table flipper
plugins.description:
Hey :)

This plugin lets you flip the table's layout, from rows to column, or columns to rows.

If the table is an instance, it will detach it.


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


Watch demo.

Support my work here <3


How to use:

  1. Select a frame that contains only a table
  2. Select the flip direction


Important notes:

Make sure to select the right direction, otherwise it will not work properly, and make sure the table is well built:

  1. Same amount of cells in all columns
  2. Same amount of cells in all rows
  3. Same width to all cells in row/column

Otherwise it will not work properly. Super important to how the plugin works.


How it works behind the scenes:

I calculate how many cells the table has by:

  1. How many rows/columns
  2. How many cells the first row/column has (I assume all others have the same number of cells).
  3. I go in a loop and re-arrange the table ( rows/columns * cells times)


Enjoy :)


(Image source: https://www.flickr.com/photos/skkorea/13529912033)
plugins.tagline: Flip table's layout direction from rows to columns / columns to rows
